title: Ánimas Trujano
descriptions:
"Ánimas Trujano" is a 1962 Mexican film directed by Ismael Rodríguez. The film centers on the character Ánimas Trujano, a poor and irresponsible man who lives in a small Oaxacan village. Trujano is known for his love of drinking and his disregard for work, preferring to live off the efforts of his long-suffering wife, Juana.

Trujano harbors a deep-seated desire to become the "mayordomo" of his village's annual festival, an honor that not only requires respectability but also significant financial resources to fund the festivities. Consumed by his ambition, Trujano becomes obsessed with achieving this status, seeing it as a means to gain the respect and admiration he lacks.

To accomplish his goal, Trujano resorts to a series of manipulative and deceitful tactics, including gambling and betrayal. His actions lead to a tumultuous journey filled with moral decay, as he sacrifices his family's wellbeing and his integrity in pursuit of superficial glory.

The film explores the themes of ambition, honor, and the social structures of rural Mexican society. "Ánimas Trujano" is a poignant and critical look at the cost of personal ambition and the consequences of losing sight of true values for fleeting social status.
